alert.note: Alert for Saratoga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:59PM EDT until April 09 at 3:01AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of eastern New York, including the following counties, Saratoga, Warren, Fulton and Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Speculator, Edinburg, Northville, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Sacandaga Campground, Moffitt Beach Campground, Day Center, Harrisburg, Hope, Arietta, Benson, Hope Falls, Blackbridge, Upper Benson, Gilmantown, Maple Grove, Bakertown, Griffin and Girards Sugarbush. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
